reviewText: This was my first live Wrestlemania. It was the first time I ever cheered at any event of any kind!! Lets go to the review!!The countdown comes and We get Welcome to Wrestlemania , Keri Hilson sings the National Anthem, and the Rock comes out to a huge ovation and does his thing for about 15 to 17 minutes then the Introduction takes place and then the camera pans to the audience and we get the pyro and that was amazing.First Match WHC match Edge vs Del Rio.....Two questions I had, Why was the winner of the Royal Rumble match for the title the first Match at Wrestlemania, why was a brand title match first? Well it was a great match, Christian and Brodus Clay came out with their perspective ppl.Their was a moment or two I thought Del Rio had the title won, especially when the armbreaker was applied. But after Edge counters a move  by Del Rio, the spear is applied by Edge and the 1, 2, 3. But WHY was this match first?Match Rating 8/10Rey Mysterio vs Cody RhodesThis was a good match> Rey Mysterio's Super Hero costumes are back again. But a key moment during match was Cody Rhodes with the standing delayed vertical superplex. Im not gonna give away the ending, but Imglad Cody had his first of many Wrestlemania moments. A good match!!Match Rating 8/10Kane, Santino Marella, Big Show, Kofi Kingston vs The Corre.Im not gonna even talk about this one.Good guys won...Match Rating 1/10CM Punk vs Randy Orton.....This was the second best match of the night.....This match had some of everything.....The Indian Deathlock which is a move that you dont see anymore. Randy Orton going for the punt, but what happens next was something, THe GTS?? And a move that was awesome to end the match.Match Rating 9/10Michael Cole vs Jerry Lawler Steve Austin Guest RefereeSeveral things about this Match...Jerry Lawler should have come into the Match, either the WWE Champion,should have been defending under triple threat rules against Cena and Miz. The decision in this match, the final decision should have never happened, it was drawn out and everything about it with the exception of 2 minutes was pathetic... I really feel bad for Jerry Lawler.Match Rating 2/10No Holds Barred Triple H vs UndertakerThe Match of the night hands sown, Match of 2011. This Match had everything, the only small criticism. Too many finishers...But since they were there, the suspense was something. The ending was shocking...This is where I cheered and cheered, through the match....Awesome AwesomeMatch Rating 20/10John Morrison , Trish Stratus and Snooki vs Dolph Ziggler and LayCoolThe only thing about this match was the moment with Snooki....But Trish Stratus is still fine.Match Rating 2/10John Cena vs The Miz WWE ChampionshipThe Miz entrance was great, John Cena entrance, If he is Christian I am all for the entrance , if not I dont get it. It was a great match. The double countout ppl should have known wasnt gonna stand. The next mooment It doesnt take a rocket scientist to figure out.It was a great match, I woulda preferred Triple H vs Undertaker to close, but with the storyline revolving around Cena Miz match I can understand it.Match Rating...7.5/10
summary: On a whole it was a GOOD Wrestlemania

reviewText: I like this Wrestlemania. Unlike 26 this year every match was worth watching. I gave this set 4 stars because of all the editing that was done to it. other then that it was awesome to relive the biggest night in sports entertainment
summary: Better then wm 26 thats for sure

reviewText: Every wrestling fan already knows that WrestleMania week is not only the biggest week in the WWE but also the biggest week in the business period considering how so many other promotions & associations base their events at the same time & location of Mania itself...however this year, WWE put out a press release at this same time stating that they no longer will have the word "wrestling" or anything related to that word referenced in their company as they want to be marketed as an "entertainment" company. Now what that has to do with this event is simple, WWE seemed that they were more focused on pushing the entertainment aspect of the show with a heavy focus on talking, backstage skits, celebrities, and promoting other projects instead of delivering what the name of the event stated...WRESTLEmania! This was the exact same case back at WrestleMania XI & I feel like we've just got an updated version of that show.A couple of notes here in that R&B; artist Keri Hilson did "American The Beautiful" while The Rock, the host of the event, came to the ring & cut a promo opening up the show...to the point where all of that combined took up the first 20 minutes of the show, Josh Matthews & Jerry Lawler did the commentary along with Michael Cole who was in his own "ColeMine" booth with both men trading insults on the commentary leading to their match later in the night, and the United States Title match between Sheamus & Daniel Bryan (both, how far have they fallen in a year) was moved to the pre-show...only for that to be turned into the traditional battle royal won by Great Khali...due to "time restraints" but as you'll read, as I'm sure have read from other reviewers, that they had the time but just wasted it with what they booked.World Champion Edge vs. Alberto Del Rio - Alberto Del Rio wins the biggest Royal Rumble in the history of WWE to fulfill his "destiny" in main event WrestleMania for the World Championship...and it's the first match on the card? Anyways it should be noted that while Del Rio had Ricardo & his ex-NXT rookie Brodus Clay (who actually lost NXT to another guy who we haven't seen on TV since while Brodus is on TV every week) in his corner, Edge had Christian (who had beaten Del Rio twice leading up to this match) in his corner. Del Rio focused heavily on Edge's arm that he had been re-injuring for the past few weeks such as throwing Edge into the steps & ringside barrier arm first while also slamming it on the announce table, applying various armbars, armdragging Edge off the top rope, and even Clay ramming his arm into the ringpost leading him to dominate the first half of the match. Edge was able to start gaining back momentum & even was able to reverse the cross armbreaker into his submission hold (which is called the Edgecator in the video games) at one point while Christian took matters into his own hands with both Ricardo & Clay on the outside. Edge eventually was able to walk away with the World Title victory that had avoided him at the past 3 Mania's but pay attention afterwords as what happened to Del Rio's car wasn't pretty.Rey Mysterio vs. Cody Rhodes - Cody was out for revenge here for no longer allowing himself to be called "Dashing" after the damage to his face while Rey wanted his own revenge for the attacks leading up to this event & for the record, the comic book outfit Rey has this year is Captain America. Cody used his mask as a weapon & targeted Rey's face with various headbutts & even going a springboard kick to the face onto Rey while also delivering impactful moves like Hardcore Holly's "Alabama Slam" & Davey Boy Smith's delayed vertical suplex from the top rope while able to keep breaking whatever momentum Rey kept trying to build throughout the match. Rey went after Cody's face as well including a headsissors to the outside with Cody's face smacking the ringside mat while later executing the 619 & a kick to Cody's exposed face. Both men went after each others weakness as Rey was able to remove Cody's mask & got payback for using it earlier while Rhodes was able to remove Rey's knee brace & had that play a factor in end.Right around here was a skit with Snoop Dogg backstage looking for WWE talent to take with him on his upcoming tour & all I have to say if that your either going to love or hate this one but my personal highlights were William Regal (always underrated when it comes to his entertainment value) & the surprise appearance of a coconut throwing legend.Big Show, Kane, Santino Marella, Kofi Kingston vs. The Corre - Santino's partner Vladimir Kozlov was suppose to be in the match but The Corre attacked him the day before during the Fan Axxess leading to Kofi taking his place. Bottom line, this match was exactly like another one on this card (I'll get to that later) in that it was "just there" as it was real short, only one tag was made during the entire match, and was just everyone getting their spots in the limited time they have. A waste of time & if anyone is actually interested in seeing these two teams have an actual "match", look for their 2 out of 3 falls match that happened later in the week on SmackDown because it will take you longer to read everything I just wrote on here than to just watch it.We have another backstage segment here as The Rock was backstage with Divas Champion Eve discussing how he's going to make a special moment with whoever comes up to him next & he entertained me...on BOTH occasions in what I conciser the best backstage skit on the whole show.Randy Orton vs. C.M. Punk - Orton came into this match with an injured leg & Punk focused directly on it with various stomps, even kicked the steps into his leg when Orton was chasing him on the outside, a modified indian deathlock, and even doing a top rope kneedrop onto Orton who was hanging from a tree of woe. This injury did effect Orton to the point where he wasn't able to push off his legs when Punk had the anaconda vice & even was able to do his punt. Orton was on the defense for most of the match but was able to get offense including an RKO that was one heck of a visual. Good match between both men.The FOURTH talk segment of the night happened here where The Rock & Mean Gene Okerland met up with one of John Cena's biggest fans...and good thing Rock didn't say the "secret word." After that, we get the traditional introduction of the Hall Of Fame class with the head of the class being Shawn Michaels but another highlight also being the well deserved crowd reaction to the "celebrity" inductee of Drew Carey.  I swear around here I'm having flashbacks to Johnathan Taylor Thomas playing chess with Bob Backlund.Jerry Lawler vs. Michael Cole - Booker T & Jim Ross joined Matthews to do commentary during this match. This match was almost a carbon copy of the Bret Hart vs. Vince McMahon match from last year's Mania where it build for so long that people wanted to see Lawler beat the hell out of Cole & we got good moments with Cole hiding in the "Colemine", the interaction between Austin & Swagger, and Austin forgetting this is a "PG" show with his censored language. Unfortunately, the match was booked TOO LONG with Michael Cole on the offensive to the point where I didn't care if Lawler beat him up, I just wanted it over. The aftermath of the match actually entertained me more than the match itself.No Holds Barred Match: Undertaker vs. Triple H - Both men started out trading punches with Taker getting aggressive first by tossing Triple H over the top, ramming him into the steps, and taking apart the spanish announce table. Triple H returned the aggression with tackling Taker through the "Colemine" & taking apart the english announce table...only to be slammed off it to the floor. A few scary moments happened such as when Taker did his famous dive over the top ropes to the floor & he wasn't caught by Triple H coming close to landing right on his neck while later Taker took a chairshot right to the head (just knowing about concussions now makes me cringe when I see that). Both men turned up the punishment various times such as a spinebuster through the spanish table, trading chairshots, a DDT on the chair, and both kicking out of finishers including 3 separate pedigrees to the point where Triple H was just screaming "STAY DOWN...JUST DIE...WHAT'S WRONG WITH YOU!?!" Triple H said before this match that he was going to finish the streak or die trying...well those words rang true but after the match, he wasn't the only person who died trying to accomplish their goal. It was different than their match a decade ago at WrestleMania but this was one that could stand out on it's own.John Morrison, Trish Stratus, Snooki from Jersey Shore vs. Dolph Ziggler & LayCool - See my review for the eight man tag, switch the names, and you get the same result here in that this match was real short to the point where only one tag was made & it was just everyone getting their spots with Snooki getting an ovation that would rival the one a "celebrity" Hall Of Famer got earlier in the night.WWE Champion The Miz vs. John Cena - Before I get started, I have to point out how the prematch videos for both men were some of the greatest videos I've seen WWE do in recent history. This was one of those matches that started slow but picked up the pace with moments like Alex Riley getting involved, Cena executing his legdrop from the top from a distance while both kicked out of the others finishers including an "A.A." that hasn't been as impactful since back when he started doing the move as the "F.U." almost a decade ago. The way the match originally finished was a bit hokey (although Miz's head took a nasty bump on the floor that gave him a concussion) leading to the appearance & involvement of the one guy you expected to get involved for weeks. This match was good but then went a little downhill with everything leading to the finish & afterwords which we found out the next night (along with all the remarks between the two for the past month) was just to setup next year's WrestleMania main event.DVD extras are scheduled to be the Sheamus vs. Daniel Bryan U.S. Title match that turns into the traditional battle royal, highlights from the final episode of RAW, and the confrontation between Cena & The Rock the night after RAW creating the main event of WrestleMania 28. Also included will be the entire Hall Of Fame ceremony honoring Shawn Michaels, Bob Armstong, Sunny, Abdullah The Butch, Road Warriors & Paul Ellering, and (SHAKES HEAD!) Drew Carey. The regular two disc edition will just have the event with no extras.In the end, this would have been a great SummerSlam or I'll go as far as a classic lower show like Over The Limit or Extreme Rules but for WrestleMania, this really just came off uneventful to me. The previous Mania's has something that changed WWE as we knew it in either the change of a character or championship but we didn't get any here along with the fact that they had TOO MUCH talk (Rock's opening promo & all those backstage skits) & attempts at entertainment & plugging projects (Lawler/Cole and Snooki/Trish) that the actual WRESTLING was scarified in the process (Morrison & Ziggler's lack of participation, the eight man tag, Sheamus & Bryan being bumped off the show). I would give this 3.5 stars but since we can't do half stars, I'll bump it up to four for the bonus extras as this had some good matches & action when it was allowed to be but overall just came off like a heavily beefed up episode of RAW with guest host The Rock instead of WrestleMania.
summary: Welcome To ENTERTAINMENTmania Starring The Rock
Title: N/A

reviewText: WWEWRESTLEMANIA 27Ah yes the Wrestlemania that followed the biggest Rumble ever, it should be just as big right? Lets see, The Rock was hosting the show, we know at least it will be entertaining. There will be guaranteed heat between him and Cena and there were some interesting storylines going into this. Of course that did not stop The Rock from talking at the beginning of the show; I knew he would come out and do that. I knew he had to make an introduction for the night but man did it take up some time, enough that one match was not put on the televised card.1.[WORLD TITLE]EDGE VS ALBERTO DEL RIO-in what would be Edge's last match Edge takes it to the new comer but Del Rio has a destiny. We start off the event with a really good match between the two although it felt a little too short. Still the action was quick and well paced with both laying into each other. After a few near finishes Edge finally hits the spear and keeps the title, but it is what happens after. After the match Edge and Christian destroy Del Rio's car as I am sure you know was very expensive. Now like many have said it made no sense for this to be the opening contest. The Royal Rumble winner Main Events Mania usually but come on opening match, and after Del Rio won a 40 man Rumble.2.REY MYSTERIO VS CODY RHODES-in this match Cody brought it to Rey for most of the match. The story here is Rey ruined his face so he wanted some revenge, for most of the match he gets it. Rey has his moments throughout the match especially after he gets Cody's mask off. This match was much better than most people around me were expecting it to be. Still Cody nails Rey with his own knee brace and gets the pin fall.3.BIG SHOW, KANE, KOFI KINGSTON, SANTINO MARELLA VS THE CORRE-I was really looking forward to this match because I love The Corre. Unfortunately this match was not that long which goes to show you what WWE thinks of tag matches. I remember back in the good old days when tag matches could be classics, even steal the show. Still for what it is it is very entertaining, unfortunately the Corre losses this one.4.CM PUNK VS RANDY ORTON-another match I was looking forward to because I am a huge CM Punk fan and was waiting to see him defeat Orton. Thankfully this match got some time so they were able to go out and put on great performances. Punk looked like he was on his way to victory until Randy nailed an RKO on Punk as he jump off the top turnbuckle. I still feel that Punk should have won this match, yes I am a fan but it felt right for the storyline to me.5.JERRY LAWLER VS MICHAEL COLE-now we all know the story here so there is no need to go into it, but I should say Booker T and Jim Ross were on commentary for this with Josh Matthews. Also Stone Cold Steve Austin was the special referee for this match and Jack Swagger was in Cole's corner, so I knew it would be fun if nothing else. This match was pure fun and that is all it was meant to be, other than a little at the beginning Jerry dominates this match. The way they [Jerry, Austin] torture Cole with the ankle lock is hilarious and seeing Austin hit Swagger, Booker T, and Josh with the Stunner was great. Of course Josh got one after he read an e-mail for the GM saying Lawler was DQ'd and Cole was the winner.6.UNDERTAKER VS TRIPLE H-this is a wonderful match right here and the best of the night most likely, well at least to some. This match has everything you could want in a match including the drama. They really tried to out do Taker's matches with HBK from the previous years and it was a valiant effort. Still nothing can top those matches and dare I say maybe their previous Mania match was better. That of course depends on your style and what you like. The action is non stop with all kinds of high spots but in the end Taker keeps the streak, but he isn't the man that walks out.7.[6 MIXED TAG]TRISH STRATUS, NICOLE POLIZZI, JOHN MORRISON VS LAYCOOL, DOLPH ZIGGLER-this match was cool enough because Trish came back but the highlight of course is Nicole pulling off a nice move. Quick match that is like the rest, fun, I guess.8.[WWE TITLE]THE MIZ VS JOHN CENA-another match I was looking forward to because I like both of these guys. I can't help it but I love The Miz, he is way too funny, I crack up all the time. The entrances were cool and the match was good as well, the best thing is I called it to a T. we all know Miz won but that ending was exactly what I thought was going to happen. I am sure any one who is reading this by now knows what happened but I called it exactly how it went.Now this was a pre Mania match and is special features on the discs.9.[US TITLE]LUMBERJACK MATCH-SHEAMUS VS DANIEL BRYAN-I was very excited to hear Matt Striker on commentary here because for some reason I like that guy. As I thought this ended up being a good match for as long as it lasted, which wasn't very long. The action is back and forth for the most but every one quickly starts brawling and it turns into a battle royal. Honestly I love battle royals but I would have loved to see a real finish for the US title match. Still the battle royal was fun as they always are with Khali coming out on top.Over all this was not the best Mania ever but I am still not sure where I would rank it amongst the others. Still a good Blu-ray to own if you are a collector like myself. The special features include a look at Edge and Del Rio's history as well as the full Hall of Fame Ceremony which of course includes HBK. Also you basically get an entire RAW.
summary: 5 STARS FOR HBK IN TH HOF
Title: N/A

reviewText: There are two awesome matches.  HHH and Undertaker are great.  CM Punk and Orton are great, as well.Aside from that, the card sucked.  That includes the main event involving Cena, the Miz, and the Rock.  It absolutely was horrible.  Spoiler alert: Cena loses by count-out to the Miz, thus failing to win the championship.  The Rock restarts the match, only to make Cena lose again.  What was the point?  There's no psychology and the WWE writers are unbelievably awful for having that be the finish.10 years prior to this, I was at Wrestlemania 17.  Wrestling has fallen a long way since then.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Anti Spoiler ReviewI Just Watched This After Finally Getting WM 27 On Blu Ray No, Doubt About It, WWE Has Gone Downhill Since WM 20 (2004) And If They Try To Make John Cena Another Hulk Hogan, SCSA Or The Rock WWE Will Flush Its Stock Down The Toilet John Cena, Ever Since WM 21, Has Been Completely Lame His Only Hope Is To Insult Others To Leech Some Type Of Forced Respect From Us Or Them, Well Irregardless, Of That He Will Get His In Due Time Because Karma Is A @%&!# Something People Above 25 Who Actually Are Grown Up And Have Grown Up Minds (Not Just Grown Up Bodies) Should Already Know.  And The Reason I Say This Is Not Because I Feel Insulted Its Because John Cena Is Truly Lame, Have You Ever Watched What John Cena Can Actually Do, Like His Promos From OVW His Raps Before WM21 He Has The Look The Talent To Get It Done But It Seems Too Late For Him Now He Became Some Kinda Lame Political Machine For Republicans Seems Like He Is Trying To Get "Good" With Texas Oil Men Or Something.  So Having That Cleared Other Than John Cena This Was A Spectacular Event The 1st Match Was Exciting, 2nd Match Was Interesting And Exciting, 3rd Match Was Exciting 2 Diff Titles Not Being Defended Due To This Being A 4Vs4 Tag Match This Is Dissappointing But This Was Still A Good Match, 4th Match Was Exciting, 5th Match Was Fun I Like The Way Cole Has Slowly Become A "Heel" Announcer It Is A Develepment That Brings Something New To The WWE, 6th Match Was Exciting, Interesting And Unbelievable Match, 7th Match Was A Fun Match Nothing Major Here But It Was Enjoyable And The 8th Match Has Its Redeeming Qualities And The Miz Did Good Here As Much As Ive Seen (Up To WM 27 So Far Miz Is Really Coming Into His Own And He Doesnt Look Like A Goofy Rooster Like He 1st Did When He Started Being Involved In Actual Matches)Blu Ray Comes With Slip Cover And Basic Blu Ray Case W/ No Insert Inside (Insert Would Be Really Nice But It Doesnt Stop Anyone Who Would Want To Buy This On Disc)(For Blu Ray)Disk 1Special FeaturesEdge And Alberto Del Rio Story (3 Min Clip On Steps Leading Up To Match)Daniel O Brian Vs Sheamus Lumberjack Match (Supposed To Be For US Title But Ended Up Being A Unique Match)WM 27 Complete Event ~ 4 Hrs1. Edge Vs Alberto Del Rio - World Heavywieght Championship2. Rey Mysterio Vs Cody Rhodes3. Wade Barrett, Heath Slater, Eziekel Jackson And Justin Gabriel making up "The Corre" VS Big Show, Kane, Kofi Kingston And Santino Marella (No Titles Up For Grabs Unifed Tag Championship Held By Justin Gabriel And Heath Slater And Intercontinental Title Held By Wade Barrett At WM27)4. CM Punk Vs Randy Orton5. Jerry The King Lawler Vs Michael Cole W/ Stone Cold Steve Austin Special Guest Referee6. Undertaker Vs Triple H No Disqualifications7. John Morrison, Trish Stratus, and Snooki vs. Dolph Ziggler and Layla and Michelle McCool "LayCool" - mixed tag match8. John Cena Vs The Miz - WWE ChampionshipDisk 2Entire Hall Of Fame 2011 ~ 2 Hrs 45 Mins (Might Be Shortened Somewhat From What Other Reviews Have Said Here And On 3 DVD Collectors Edition I Am Not Sure)(Blu Ray Exclusives)(I Believe Instead Of This Disc 2 On 3 DVD Collectors Edition Has Bunch Of WWE Legendary Moments ~ 35 Moments)Jerry The King Lawler Vs Jack Swagger - Raw 3/28/11Triple H Won't Back Down From Undertaker - Raw 3/28/11 (~22 Mins)Finally The Rock Has Come Back To Chicago - Raw 3/28/11 (~23 Mins)The Rock And John Cena Annonce The Main Event For WrestleMania 28 - Raw 4/4/11 (~18 Mins)Total Altogether ~ 70 Mins Of WWE Monday Night Raw Extras
summary: By Far The Best WrestleManias Since WM 24 Maybe Even Better Than That

reviewText: First off i would like to start off by saying that I am a huge John Cena fan and don't like what happened to him in the main event but everyone knew it was coming. I mean you don't expect The Rock to get an Attitude Adjustment and just take it lying down. This was a pretty good wrestlemania especially the Undertaker vs Triple H and Edge vs Alberto Del Rio matches. I can't say enough about the Undertaker vs Triple H match. It's definantly the show stealer and one of the best matches i've ever seen in my life. I mean these two beat the hell out of each other. It just gives you even more respect for the dead man and the game. If you are in question of whether to buy this or not definantly buy it just for the undertaker vs triple h match. Trust me you will be far from disappointed.
Title: N/A
